data.title: This week's WCW is on Amanda Seyfried! Amanda is an American actress, singer, and inspiration to others. She began her modeling career at...
data.meta_description: 54 likes, 3 comments - suzanneevents on October 6, 2021: "This week's WCW is on Amanda Seyfried! Amanda is an American actress, singer, and inspiration to others. She began her modeling career at the young age of eleven and began acting at fifteen, appearing in roles as Lucy Montgomery on the popular CBS soap opera, As The World Turns and Joni Stafford in ABC drama, All my Children( 2003). Seyfried was well known for her role in the very popular film Mean Girls as Karen Smith; and for her recurring role in the TV series Veronica Mars as Lily Kane. Seyfried appeared in several independent films; Nine Lives, Alpha Dog, and had a notable role in HBO’s Big Love ( 2006- 2011). She went on to star in a number of acclaimed films including, Mamma Mia!, Solstice, Jennifer's Body,  Chloe, Dear John, Letters to Juliet,  Red Riding Hood, and  Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again. Seyfried achieved her success in the musical,  Les Misérables (2012), where she won the Satellite Award for Best Cast/Motion Picture and was nominated for the Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance in a Motion Picture. She has also won Critics' Choice Movie Award, the Golden Globe Award, and the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. Seyfried was on numerous covers in magazines and was well known for her ranking in People’s Magazine as she was featured in "25 Beauties (and Hotties) at 25" and was included in Vanity Fair's "Bright Young Hollywood" article in 2008. Aside from her many successes in the entertainment industry, Seyfried is devoted to giving back. She is a board member of the NGO INARA, which provides medical services to children who have been severely injured in war zones concentrating on refugee children from Syria. Seyfried has also dedicated her time to helping many numerous foundations including Autism Speaks, Believe in Dreams, Children’s Miracle Network Hospitals, March of Dimes, and St. Judes Children’s Research Hospital. Seyfried says of Inara ““INARA is a small organization making a huge impact in the lives of children affected by war. As a mother, there are few things I feel are more worthy of our time, energy and support.”” - Amanda Seyfried.".
